page.title: 10RUDDLES,THE RUTLAND BREWERY
page.content: Ruddles Brewery was founded in Langham in 1858.George Ruddle joined the business in 1896,and his son,the late Sir Kenneth Ruddle took over the firm in 1945.The present Chairman is Tony Ruddle,Sir Kenneth's son.The Brewery is now a Public Company.Until the late 1960's the company was a small regional brewery supplying its own tied houses as well as the trade. Recently Ruddles sold its last public house the "Noel Arms" at Langham and is concentrating on new markets e.g. grocery chains such as Sainsbury's and Waitrose.Using traditional brewing methods Ruddles produce Ruddles County,Rutland Bitter and Ruddles Barley Wine.Whole aroma hops and high quality malt are brewed in the modern plant with the help of technological aids.The firm has won many prizes for its beer and packaging.
